<!-- It contains information about your site's posts, pages, comments, categories, and other content. -->
<!-- You may use this file to transfer that content from one site to another. -->
<!-- This file is not intended to serve as a complete backup of your site. -->

<!-- To import this information into a WordPress site follow these steps: -->
<!-- 1. Log in to that site as an administrator. -->
<!-- 2. Go to Tools: Import in the WordPress admin panel. -->
<!-- 3. Install the "WordPress" importer from the list. -->
<!-- 4. Activate & Run Importer. -->
<!-- 5. Upload this file using the form provided on that page. -->
<!-- 6. You will first be asked to map the authors in this export file to users -->
<!--    on the site. For each author, you may choose to map to an -->
<!--    existing user on the site or to create a new user. -->
<!-- 7. WordPress will then import each of the posts, pages, comments, categories, etc. -->
<!--    contained in this file into your site. -->

	<item>
		<title>Hoop Tutorials</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/?page_id=152</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 07 Jul 2010 08:10:12 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?page_id=152</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I have put together a list of tutorials that I found on YouTube that actually taught me a move. Hopefully this will be a helpful resource for you to learn to hoop. These tutorials are not made by Pyromancy, the owners will be credited in this collection.

<strong>Hooping at the Chest:</strong>
<object classid="clsid:d27cdb6e-ae6d-11cf-96b8-444553540000" width="480" height="385" codebase="http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0"><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true" /><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always" /><param name="src" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/MslvDS_8z7Q&amp;hl=en_US&amp;fs=1&amp;" /><param name="allowfullscreen" value="true" /><embed type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="480" height="385" src="http://www.youtube.com/v/MslvDS_8z7Q&amp;hl=en_US&amp;fs=1&amp;" allowscriptaccess="always" allowfullscreen="true"></embed></object>

Credit: <a href="http://www.youtube.com/user/FireSandra">FireSandra</a> : <a href="http://www.hoopcity.ca">Hoop City</a>

<strong>Hooping at the Legs:</strong>
<object classid="clsid:d27cdb6e-ae6d-11cf-96b8-444553540000" width="480" height="385" codebase="http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0"><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true" /><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always" /><param name="src" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/OuH-xnLMpRU&amp;hl=en_US&amp;fs=1&amp;" /><param name="allowfullscreen" value="true" /><embed type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="480" height="385" src="http://www.youtube.com/v/OuH-xnLMpRU&amp;hl=en_US&amp;fs=1&amp;" allowscriptaccess="always" allowfullscreen="true"></embed></object>

Credit: <a href="http://www.youtube.com/user/Caroleeena">Caroleeena</a>

<strong>The Shimmy</strong>: Waist to Neck/Shoulder with arms down
<object classid="clsid:d27cdb6e-ae6d-11cf-96b8-444553540000" width="480" height="385" codebase="http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0"><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true" /><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always" /><param name="src" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/fhnNElaWEiE&amp;hl=en_US&amp;fs=1&amp;" /><param name="allowfullscreen" value="true" /><embed type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="480" height="385" src="http://www.youtube.com/v/fhnNElaWEiE&amp;hl=en_US&amp;fs=1&amp;" allowscriptaccess="always" allowfullscreen="true"></embed></object>

Credit: <a href="http://www.youtube.com/user/FireSandra">FireSandra</a> : <a href="http://www.hoopcity.ca">Hoop City</a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>PRIVATE: Instructions for Updating the Calendar </title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/?page_id=245</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 09 Aug 2010 18:36:17 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?page_id=245</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Step 1 : Is there a Facebook Event Page for this?   if yes, continue..

Step 2: Go to the Events Page and locate the "Export Event" link on the bottom
<a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/08/screencap-1.png"><img src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/08/screencap-1-300x153.png" alt="" title="screencap 1" width="300" height="153" class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-256" /></a>
Step 3: Save event as an ICAL format ( .ics ) on your harddrive

Step 4: Go to <a href="http://calendar.google.com">Google Calendar</a> . You need ADMIN privledges and to be subscribed - please email Gillian for this info.

Step 5: Click settings as shown in screenshot below
<a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/08/screencap2.png"><img src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/08/screencap2-300x219.png" alt="" title="screencap2" width="300" height="219" class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-257" /></a>

Step 6: Click IMPORT CALENDAR as show in screenshot
<a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/08/screencap2-5.png"><img src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/08/screencap2-5-300x295.png" alt="" title="screencap2-5" width="300" height="295" class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-258" /></a>

Step 7: Select the .ics file and add it to the calendar PYROMANCY
<a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/08/screencap3.png"><img src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/08/screencap3-300x150.png" alt="" title="screencap3" width="300" height="150" class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-259" /></a> 

Step 8: It will then appear on website if you refresh, if it doesnt immediately go to <a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-admin/options-general.php?page=ics-import.php">calendar settings </a> and click save settings to refresh it in the cache. 

TROUBLESHOOOTING IF YOU DONT SEE YOUR EVENT:
You probably added the event to the wrong calendar, you can change the calendar the event belongs to in event details in google calendar... or you didnt do step 8 properly. 


]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Party for the Parks 2010 / Spin Jam [Flickr]</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/?page_id=429</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 28 Sep 2010 23:06:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Potter Dee]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div align="right"> Photo Galleries: 
[xls child_of=238]</div>
Pyromancy performing at <a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/calendar/?ics-perm=4v7citke5c6gf56h5aaqlou0c4@google.com">Olmstead Conservancy's Party for the Parks 2010</a> and <a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/calendar/?ics-perm=e139472042763983@facebook.com">9/27/10 Spin Jam</a>.   
Flickr set photographed by Olga Grinberg.
[flickr-gallery mode="photoset" photoset="72157624924949007"]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>429</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2010-09-28 19:06:49]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2010-09-28 23:06:49]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:comment_status>

	<item>
		<title>NOTE ON VIDEOS: THE PYROMANCY YOUTUBE ACCOUNT INFO!</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/?page_id=456</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 30 Nov -0001 00:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[THE PYROMANCY YOUTUBE ACCOUNT INFO!


you can upload videos here:

youtube
login: gillian@pyromancy.org
pwd: pyromancy1


for videos to appear on this site on the video page, it needs to be added to my playlist "fire performance". i think i have to do that manually so send me a msg!

- GILLIAN]]></content:encoded>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title></title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/?page_id=564</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 30 Nov -0001 00:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Potter Dee]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Fire and LED Performance for Hire
A Wide Range of Indoor and Outdoor Shows
Perfect for Weddings, Birthdays, Fundraisers,                Bar Mitzvahs, Graduations, Luaus,  Films, Promotions, DJ Sets, Corporate Events , anything you can imagine
Safe and Professional


What we provide:
Awesome fire performance!
Trained safety techs with fully equipped first aid and safety equipment.
Lighted perimeter ropes if needed.
Venue inspection before anything is agreed upon.  
Small sound system with our own music.


Show formats:

Street performance, two or three performers will alternate with different acts, fire eating, sometimes a story or simple duets.  15-20 minute sets.    

Circle Show, With more performers, we can do a longer, more energy intensive set.  Quick changes between performers, fire and non-fire performances, juggling, fire eating, acrobatics, if space allows, more complex duets and trio performances. 30-40 minute sets.

Choreographed Routines:  Have a specific piece of music you want a fancy performance for, or need fire performers for a film/theater production?  Depending on the length, desired complexity, and practice time, we can work on custom performances.  

Non-fire Performances:  We have growing supply of exciting non-fire props that look just as good, if not better then our fire performances. Please keep an eye on our video page for previews in the coming weeks.  Non-fire performances are quite a bit cheaper and can be really fantastic for day time events. 

Fire Spinning Safety Coordination for Festivals:  Got a music festival you want to let attendees spin fire at?  We can provide safety classes, skill/competency vetting, running a safe spin area, and help designing a comprehensive safety program for your festival.  

Suggestions:  
Two to four performers for 20-40 minutes is a really good show.  We only recommend longer performances if there is going to be a moving audience, or other concurrent acts, such as music festivals.  We are still building our repertoire and expect to be able to offer more complex performances soon. 

Available upon request:
Fire Breathing - Fire Breathing is pretty risky to the performer, it isn't a skill we are really that into.  It is not part of our general packages but can be provided on request.

Colored Fire - We have been experimenting with colored flames, they look pretty wild, but don't come cheap.  

Live Music - From drum circles to concert violinists, we know a number of musicians   

  

]]></content:encoded>

The video features footage of Theatre Alliance of Buffalo productions. Visit: www.theatreallianceofbuffalo.com.
Historic photos courtesy of the Collection of Buffalo and Erie County Historical Society, used by permission.

		<title>About Test Page</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/?page_id=924</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 30 Nov -0001 00:00:00 +0000</pubDate>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<object width="300" height="203"><param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/Puv52gj1iWo?version=3&amp;hl=en_US&amp;rel=0"></param><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"></param><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/v/Puv52gj1iWo?version=3&amp;hl=en_US&amp;rel=0" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="300" height="203" allowscriptaccess="always" allowfullscreen="true"></embed></object>

	<item>
		<title>Ticket</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/?page_id=2109</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 30 Nov -0001 00:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[

		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>2109</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2016-05-02 14:04:09]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[0000-00-00 00:00:00]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[draft]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[page]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>About</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/about/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 07 Apr 2010 02:30:13 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://pyromancy.mirrorlabs.com/?page_id=2</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<br/><strong>py·ro·man·cy</strong>
   /ˈpaɪrəˌmænsi/   [pahy-ruh-man-see]
–noun
divination by fire, or by forms appearing in fire.</br>

Pyromancy Fire Performance Troupe specializes in promoting the art of Fire Dancing, Object Manipulation, Circus and Flow Arts. Founded in 2010, they have performed at over 70 public and private events in the Western New York area. The troupe is made up of skilled and dedicated performers from a variety of backgrounds who are passionate about sharing their love of fire spinning and dancing!  

Interested in adding a unique spectacle to your next party, festival, or community event? Delivering a entertaining, safe and professional performance is the utmost priority for us!  Information on our <a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/booking/safety-protocol/">safety protocol and insurance policies</a> is found here. We have a full range of fire and LED props to accommodate outdoor, indoor and daytime events. Options for performance include individuals , troupe, single act, full show and background entertainment. We are located in Buffalo, NY, USA and can travel to your location.  Please contact or call us ( 716.875.0791 ) with your specific requirements and we will tailor a performance to suit your needs. 

<strong><u>What:</u></strong> Fire, LED, and Daylight performances using a wide variety of props. Includes: Poi, Single and Multi Hooping, Staff, Baton, Fans, 3-Section Staff, Samoan Hook Knives, Rope Dart, Sword, Jump Rope, Levistick / Flow Wand, Palm Torches, Juggling, Stilts, Fire Eating and Breathing, Flags and Streamers. Inspiration is drawn from martial arts weapons, baton twirling/colorgaurd, electronic music scene, magic and illusion and traditional belly dance. Interactive options offered include rental of practice / led hoops for guests, hoop making, and event instruction and workshops. 

<strong><u>Where:</u></strong> We have performed at events ranging from concerts, private parties, street performances, art festivals, nightclubs, stage productions, television and film shoots. Please check out our comprehensive list of <a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/past-gigs/">past performances</a> and media coverage on the <a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/category/press/">press page</a>! During the off season we host an open weekly spinjam and skill share and are dedicated to teaching and spreading the word about these amazing arts!

Watch our promo reels to get an preview of our wide variety of talented performers.

 <!-- Nav tabs --><ul class="nav nav-tabs" role="tablist">    <li class="active"><a href="#home" role="tab" data-toggle="tab">Group Photo</a></li>    <li><a href="#profile" role="tab" data-toggle="tab">Fire Performance Demo Video</a></li>   <li><a href="#messages" role="tab" data-toggle="tab">LED Demo Video</a></li></ul><!-- Tab panes --><div class="tab-content"><div class="tab-pane active" id="home"><a href="http://www.pyromancy.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/04/group-resiz.png"><img src="http://www.pyromancy.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/04/group-resiz.png" alt="" title="group-resiz" width="550" height="516" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-948"/></a></div>   <div class="tab-pane" id="profile"><br/><div align="center">[youtube]Puv52gj1iWo[/youtube]</div> </div>   <div class="tab-pane" id="messages">     <br/>    <div align="center">[youtube]ZxAN8HKudgU[/youtube]</div>    </div></div>
]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Booking </title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/booking/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 07 Apr 2010 02:55:59 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://pyromancy.mirrorlabs.com/?page_id=6</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Pyromancy specializes in fire toys and props of all shapes and sizes, including poi, hoop, twins/minis (double hoop), rope dart, staff, fans. Whether it be collaborative or solo performance, indoor or outdoor, LED lights or fire you desire, add a unique spectacle to your next party, festival, community event. Check out Pyromancy in the news on our <a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/category/press/">press page</a>!


Contact us with your specific requirements (type of event, indoor/outdoor, length, number of performers, space available)  and we will provide a tailored performance which includes rates (including travel costs), performance options, fire artists' bios, and more details. Safety is an utmost priority for us, and you can find information about our <a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/booking/safety-protocol/">safety protocol here.</a>  <strong>We are located in Buffalo, NY, USA and can travel to your location.</strong>

Please fill out the <a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/contact/">inquiry form</a> or if you'd like to talk to us immediately, call us at 716.875.0791
]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Contact</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/contact/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 07 Apr 2010 02:56:08 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://pyromancy.mirrorlabs.com/?page_id=8</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div style="margin-bottom: -5px;">Alternate email: pyromancybuffalo@gmail.com</div>
[ninja_form id=12]
<h1 class="entry-title">Phone</h1>
<div class="large-hrule "></div>
<script>
var probablyPhone = ((/iphone|android|ie|blackberry|fennec/).test(navigator.userAgent.toLowerCase()) && 'ontouchstart' in document.documentElement);
function initializePhone() {
	if ( !probablyPhone ) {
		//alert ("Your device is probably not a phone");
		( function( $ ) { 
			$( '.call' ).css ( "text-decoration", "none" );
			$( '.call' ).css ( "color", "black" );
			$( '.call' ).css ( "cursor", "default" );			
		} )( jQuery );
	}
}
initializePhone();
</script>
<ul style="font-size: 14px; margin-bottom: 20px;">
 	<li><strong>Potter Dee: </strong><a class="call" href="tel:7167995831">716.799.5831</a></li>
</ul>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Gillian Tunney</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/about/performers/gillian-tunney/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 04 May 2010 06:17:21 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://pyromancy.mirrorlabs.com/?page_id=31</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Gillian Tunney has been baton twirling for New York City audiences for the past six years at venues such as Avalon, The Knitting Factory, Crobar and Coney Island!  After twirling with Burlesque/Cabaret troupes like <a href="http://www.theloveshownyc.com"> The Love Show</a> and Oh De Twirlette she decided to form the new group, <a href="http://batonrougenyc.com">Baton Rouge NYC</a>, with sister Jocelyn. Since moving to Buffalo NY, she has taken up fire spinning more frequently and expanded her skills to include hula hoops,  hooplets ( twin minis ), double staff, rope dart and poi, and is now performing with the fire performance troupe, Pyromancy. She is constantly working to expand her skills and attends workshop retreats like <a href="http://www.wildfireretreat.com/">Wildfire</a> and <a href="http://www.hoopconvergence.org/">Hoop Convergence</a>. When not twirling, she is a <a href="http://gilliantunney.com">Flash/Flex/PHP/Multimedia Developer</a> and also works in <a href="http://www.secondlife.com">Second Life</a>! She also created this Pyromancy website.
<a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/05/flickr2.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-425" title="Gillian Poi" src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/05/flickr2-300x200.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="200" /></a>

Contact:
• AIM: snailicide
•<a href="http://www.youtube.com/gbtunney">YouTube Channel with hoop and performance videos</a>
•<a href="http://batonrougenyc.com">Baton Rouge NYC</a>
•<a href="http://www.facebook.com/gbtunney">Facebook</a>
•<a href="http://twitter.com/gbtunney">Twitter</a>
•<a href="http://gilliantunney.com">Portfolio</a>

<a title="Gillian Tunney" href="https://www.facebook.com/gbtunney" target="_TOP"><img style="border: 0px;" src="https://badge.facebook.com/badge/534594070.3219.1149715447.png" alt="" /></a>

		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>31</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2010-05-04 02:17:21]]></wp:post_date>

		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:comment_status>

		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_slidedeck_slide_title]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Gillian Tunney]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Safety Protocol</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/booking/safety-protocol/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 08 May 2010 05:25:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Potter Dee]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://pyromancy.mirrorlabs.com/?page_id=35</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Safety First!</p>

<p>Pyromancy takes safety seriously, and we dedicated to providing secure and positive experience.</p>

<p>Each of our performers has gone through a professional fire safety class, adhere to good practice in performance, and perform safety/equipment checks before every performance. We bring a full compliment of safety equipment, not limited to; audience barrier markers, fire extinguishers, fire proof towels, first aid kit, MSDS sheets for all fuels and chemicals, insurance policy documentation and an unblemished record of safety.</p>

<p>Before finalizing plans for a show we will come and examine the performance space to ensure adequate space and to check for any potential hazards. Before each show,we set up a fuel dump well away from the audience and performers, check all equipment for damage, go over our communications. During the show, a dedicated safety will monitor not only the performers, but the audience and surrounding areas. We reserve the right to modify or refuse a performance if we do not feel we can safely perform in a venue. Glow/LED and non-fire performances can also be arranged to accommodate the venue.</p>

<p>We adhere to <a href="http://www.nafaa.org/nafaa_safety.html">North American Fire Arts Association safety regulations and guidelines</a>.</p>

<p><a href="http://www.pyromancy.org/about/performers/fuego/">Fuego</a> is the group's lead safety coordinator. She holds American Red Cross Certifications in First Aid and CPR.</p>

<strong>INSURANCE INFORMATION</strong>
<a href="http://www.specialtyinsuranceagency.com/">Specialty Insurance Agency</a>

Six of our performers ( Potter Dee, Gillian Tunney, Fuego, Shoola, Maia Alexandra and Leo Powell ) are insured by <a href="http://www.specialtyinsuranceagency.com/performer-insurance.html">Specialty
Insurance Agency – Entertainer Insurance</a> though January 1, 2013.

The Performers of the US insurance program is designed for the individual who is entertaining the public. The policy provides protection against bodily injury or property damage to a spectator during your performance.

 The 2012 – 2013 shared policy limits of coverage for all members are as follows:
Each Occurrence: 	$3,000,000 	(bodily injury & property damage to others)
Damage to Rented Premises:  	$100,000 	(to rented premises)
Personal & Advertising Injury: 	$3,000,000 	(hurting someone's feelings)
General Aggregate: 	$5,000,000 	(the most the policy will pay out during the policy year)
Products – Completed Op. Agg.: 	$5,000,000 	(the most the policy will pay out during the policy year)
Medical Expenses: 	$5,000 	(emergency medical to others injured by you)

Additional information is found on Specialty Insurance's website.

<strong>Insurance documentation will be made available upon request!</strong>
﻿]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[{{unknown}}]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Potter Dee</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/about/performers/doktor-potter-dee/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 24 Jun 2010 20:40:04 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Potter Dee]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://pyromancy.mirrorlabs.com/?page_id=104</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Where did this all start?  I guess it was Starwood a number of years ago, I got to play with a three foot, green, flaming sword, after photographing a performance.  It's like nothing else in the world to handle something that only exists in movies and books, especially when it is starts to roar when you move it, the sound and light block out everything else and you enter a private world of movement and energy.  I knew I was never going to be able to put fire down after that.  I came home to find two of my best friends were actually hosting some fire performers, Ember Erebus and Flint, of the S. Vestas Circus and we were about to have two weeks of private instructions and lessons.  There was no turning back.

Two years later I met my partner Gillian and we decided we had enough talented people to try to book some gigs.  We managed to attract a lot of amazing attention and a few media spots got us going, now we have over 100 shows under our belts, and are seeing a group of friends becoming a trained and disciplined troupe of performers.

 I specialize in "soft weapons", nunchucks, three-section staff, rope dart, and most recently, bull-whip.  "Soft" because they have moving parts, they still hurt.  In martial-arts they are called "self-disciplining", because your master doesn't need to hit you when you mess up.  Training myself to perform with these dangerous props has been no easy task, the three-section staff was really kind of brutal, one of the most taxing physical endeavors I've embarked on.  The plus, is that you learn fast!  I really like working with the unusual movements of the flexible weapons and exploring what sets them apart from other weapons and props, pushing those limits into a unique performance.  

]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>PRIVATE: STOP ANALYTICS FROM TRACKING YOUR HITS!</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/private-stop-analytics-from-tracking-your-hits/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 11 Aug 2010 19:37:32 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Stop analytics from tracking your hits on the site so we get an accurate profile of visitors.

This only works on firefox. 

1. Install the adblock  plus add-on for firefox   here https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/1865/

2. Go to tools-->adblock plus preferences

Add a filter with this:

google-analytics.com$domain=pyromancy.org



-- it should not track.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Leo Powell</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/about/performers/leo-powell/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 28 Sep 2010 05:27:24 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Potter Dee]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/09/Leo-Stargate.jpg"><img src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/09/Leo-Stargate-225x300.jpg" alt="" title="Leo Stargate" width="225" height="300" class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-418" /></a>
Leo started learning fire poi in Tucson from the University of Arizona Street Performance and Incendiary Arts Club in 2003. After one year with SPIA then sitting-President Mathew Johnson of FireMecca.com graduated and he succeeded him. Leo's style is a mix of Aikido footwork, burst rhythms, and technical trickery. His own graduation swept him away to another realm of foreign immersion, experimental psychedelic rock-metal, naturalism, and mixed media art. For several years he had been without affiliation and poi had been a fire-side entertainment medium for him to share only with friends. He's grateful now to be a card-carrying “magician” out in the Buffalo streets sharing his blood with the wind and watching you gasp and wince!

<a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/09/Leo-meditates.jpg"><img src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/09/Leo-meditates-242x300.jpg" alt="" title="Leo meditates" width="242" height="300" class="alignright size-medium wp-image-419" /></a>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Press</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/press/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 29 Sep 2010 02:58:35 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>

		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[page]]></wp:post_type>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>J.D. Devine</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/about/performers/j-d-devine/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 15 Oct 2010 20:14:42 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[“Fire displays the twin characteristics of malice and intelligence.”

- A. Artaud

J.D. Devine has juggled fire for nearly twenty years, and has had a lifelong fascination with fire. Fire fascinates us all: it is an aetheric but deadly substance (if it indeed has substance at all). Handling fire is dangerous, but confronting that danger is what fire handling is all about. J.D. juggles torches and the high tech FireFly © Balls, which give an up close and personal experience with the fire. In addition to the fire, he also juggles knives, a bowling ball… just about anything! He is constantly updating his skills, and recently took a workshop with the Flying Karamazov Brothers. Let’s hope J.D. continues to dazzling us with death defying and gravity defying feats!
]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>461</wp:post_id>

		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:comment_status>

		<title>Pyromancy Logo Materials</title>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<em>To save .pngs, right click ( control + click for macs ) and "save link as" </em>

<h2>VIDEO TITLE SCREENS</h2>
<em>To save .pngs, right click ( control + click for macs ) and "save link as" </em>
- <a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/10/PM-Video-Title-Screen-720x480-NTSC-DV.png">Title Screen 720x480 (NTSC-DV)</a>

- <a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/10/PM-Video-End-Screen-720x480-NTSC-DV.png">End Screen 720x480 (NTSC-DV)</a>

- <a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/10/PM-Video-Title-Screen-1280x720-HDVHDTV-720p29.97.png">Title Screen 1280x720 (HDVHDTV-720p29.97)</a>

- <a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/10/PM-Video-End-Screen-1280x720-HDVHDTV-720p29.97.png">End Screen 1280x720-(HDVHDTV-720p29.97)</a>

<strong>For questions or help regarding these files please contact Gillian Tunney at 718.813.8156 or gillian[at]pyromancy.org.
</strong>

	<item>
		<title>Past Performances</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/past-gigs/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 21 Mar 2011 17:12:05 +0000</pubDate>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Here is a comprehensive list of past performances and appearances:

<div id="2016"></div>
<h1>2016</h1>

October 23rd, 2016
Knockturn Alley Fest at Dreamland
Children's hoop workshop 

October 22nd, 2016
Private Halloween Party
North Tonawanda, NY

October 16th, 2016
Private Event
Williamsville, NY

University at Buffalo

Steampunk Festival 2016
Leonard Oakes Estate Winery

Buffalo Outer Harbor

June 17th, 2016
13th Annual Brant Summerfest
Brant, NY

June 4-5th, 2016 
Hollywood Happening with Buffalo Aerial Dance
Gowanda, NY

May 14th, 2016
Workshop: Fire Spinning Safety Training
Buffalo, NY

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Maia Alexandra</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/about/performers/maia-alexandra/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 01 Sep 2011 14:45:44 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?page_id=720</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/Maia-Alexandra-firehoop.jpg"><img src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/Maia-Alexandra-firehoop.jpg" alt="" title="Maia-Alexandra - firehoop" width="468" height="411" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-721" /></a>

Maia Alexandra has been a professional dancer since 1997, and is a multi-award winning bellydance performer and teacher. She came to fire relatively recently when attending a middle eastern dance retreat and saw another dancer using a flaming hula hoop. Instantly entranced, Maia swore at that moment that she must learn this truly beautiful art. She scoured the internet for resources, learned to make her own hoops, and made many friends in the hooping community. Her first burn was July 2008, and now Maia has expanded her repertoire to include palm torches, fire eating, and a flaming jump rope as well as her 8 spoke LED/ Fire combination hoop.

She has great respect for the flame, and those who wield it.

Maia loves to flow through the conjunction of movement, music, and theatrics. She hopes to create vivid and memorable performances that are as artful and inspiring to others as the first hooper she saw was to her.

- Website - <a target="_blank" href="http://www.maiaalexandra.com/">Maia Alexandra : Experience the Art of Dance</a>

- <a target="_blank" href="http://www.facebook.com/groups/127467393957065/doc/232648840105586/#!/pages/Maia-Alexandra-Experience-the-Art-of-Dance/312134861560">Facebook Page</a>
]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>

	<item>
		<title>Mandy Moore</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/about/performers/mandy-moore/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 03 Oct 2011 15:24:37 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?page_id=725</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I go by Mandy, and Mandemonium (the keeper of Pandemonium). The Doktor showed me the fire long ago, and soon I couldn't resist. I've only been playing with fire for a year or so, and fire baton is my specialty. I do fancy hand movements and tosses hoping to shock and amaze....the oohhhss and ahhhs of the crowd...be still my heart. The fire poi is more of an amusement, but it loosens me up for the fire, oh yes, the fire baton. :}

I also enjoy keeping the fire at bay as a safety. As much as I love to see the flames rise up, I like to see them go out in a safe fashion.

<a href="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/223649_10150325096513653_538973652_9348448_6761016_n.jpg"><img src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/223649_10150325096513653_538973652_9348448_6761016_n-300x200.jpg" alt="" title="Mandy Moore- Sirous" width="300" height="200" class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-730" /></a>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>725</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2011-10-03 11:24:37]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2011-10-03 15:24:37]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[mandy-moore]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>816</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>6</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[page]]></wp:post_type>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Insurance</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/insurance/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 15 Aug 2012 16:24:45 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.pyromancy.org/?page_id=1214</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://www.specialtyinsuranceagency.com/">Specialty Insurance Agency</a>

Six of our performers ( Potter Dee, Gillian Tunney, Fuego, Madam Moonshyn, Maia Alexandra and Leo Powell ) are insured by <a href="http://www.specialtyinsuranceagency.com/performer-insurance.html">Specialty Insurance Agency - Entertainer Insurance</a> though January 1, 2013.

The Performers of the US insurance program is designed for the individual who is entertaining the public. The policy provides protection against bodily injury or property damage to a spectator during your performance.

 The 2012 – 2013 shared policy limits of coverage for all members are as follows:
Each Occurrence: 	$3,000,000 	(bodily injury & property damage to others)
Damage to Rented Premises:  	$100,000 	(to rented premises)
Personal & Advertising Injury: 	$3,000,000 	(hurting someone's feelings)
General Aggregate: 	$5,000,000 	(the most the policy will pay out during the policy year)
Products – Completed Op. Agg.: 	$5,000,000 	(the most the policy will pay out during the policy year)
Medical Expenses: 	$5,000 	(emergency medical to others injured by you)

Insurance documentation will be made available upon request!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1214</wp:post_id>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div style="padding-top: 10px; padding-bottom: 10px;" align="center"><a href="/category/Photos"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-954" title="Photo" src="http://www.pyromancy.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/01/photo.png" alt="" width="178" height="70" /></a><a href="http://www.pyromancy.org/category/videos/"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-953" title="Video" src="http://www.pyromancy.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/01/video.png" alt="" width="158" height="71" /></a></div>

	<item>
		<title>Performers</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/about/performers/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 15 Jan 2012 01:52:10 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.pyromancy.org/?page_id=816</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Performers]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>816</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2012-01-14 20:52:10]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2012-01-15 01:52:10]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[performers]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>2</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[page]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>

	<item>
		<title>Fuego</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/about/performers/fuego/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 14 Jun 2012 18:41:40 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.pyromancy.org/?page_id=1092</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<strong>Props: </strong>Fire eating, fire breathing, poi, sword, dragon staff, fans

Fuego has been unnaturally attracted to fire since she was a small child. <a style="float:right;margin:20px;" href="http://www.pyromancy.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/06/photo1.jpg"><img src="http://www.pyromancy.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/06/photo1-224x300.jpg" alt="" title="photo" width="224" height="300" class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-1245" /></a>Hoarding magnifying glasses to try to burn leaves (never ants, that's cruel) turned into collecting lighters and candles in her teens and early twenties. The mid to late twenties created a bond with fire, as she had more opportunity to build and tend fires while camping. This is where she learned respect for fire. Thirty brought a new change. A relationship with fire. Fuego learned that fire likes to play, and be played with, and a friendship was born. Now Fuego takes pleasure stunning audiences with resistance to flame, an awe inspiring ability to be on fire and not burn, to transfer fire from one torch to another using skin or even her tongue, and, ultimately to consume fire, bringing warmth to her soul; and shock from the crowd. Fuego is constantly experimenting with different ways to play with her friendly fire, and learn new ways to not burn herself. Fuego also dabbles in spinning fire poi, and is dedicated to learning as many fire toys as she can.



]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1092</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2012-06-14 14:41:40]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2012-06-14 18:41:40]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[fuego]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>816</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>7</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[page]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Shoola</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/madam-moonshyn/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 15 Jun 2012 16:53:31 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.pyromancy.org/?page_id=1101</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a style="float: left; margin: 20px;" href="http://www.pyromancy.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/06/63850_430786881403_626266403_5188704_3732173_n.jpg"><img class="alignnone size-thumbnail wp-image-1102" title="63850_430786881403_626266403_5188704_3732173_n" src="http://www.pyromancy.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/06/63850_430786881403_626266403_5188704_3732173_n-150x150.jpg" alt="" width="150" height="150" /></a>In 2007 Holly Rutkowski aka Madam Moonshyn began exploring dance, flow and manipulation with props. Hula hooping has become a way of dancing as well as a meditative outlet. Being completely mesmerized with fire it was naturally the next step. Holly’s style of performing reflects her intense but very down to earth personality. She gives 100 percent in every show which can be very personal and provocative. <a style="float: right; margin: 20px;" href="http://www.pyromancy.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/06/6208_550714686633_44201278_32809400_7743343_n.jpg"><img class="alignnone size-thumbnail wp-image-1114" title="6208_550714686633_44201278_32809400_7743343_n" src="http://www.pyromancy.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/06/6208_550714686633_44201278_32809400_7743343_n-150x150.jpg" alt="" width="150" height="150" /></a>Holly's skills have broadened to fire orb, silk flags, palm torches, fleshing, sustained spinning and fire fingers. Holly has traveled out of state and even out of country to perfect her skills at various retreats and workshops and doesn’t plan to stop burning any time soon!

Holly has performed at events such as Elmwood Art Festival, Infringement Festival, Curtain Up, Party for the Parks, Riverfest, Peep Show, Family Dawgz Campout, The Weekend Off and Venues such as Town Ballroom, PURE, Norfolk Music Park and Noir.

When Holly isnt performing she is making natural body products, repurposed clothing and working as a Homeless Outreach Case Manager for a local nonprofit.

<a href="http://www.etsy.com/shop/MoonshynDesign">Etsy Shop: http://www.etsy.com/shop/MoonshynDesign</a>

<div align="center">
<a href="http://www.pyromancy.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/06/291958_10150259138660163_732270162_7888795_2155774_n.jpg"><img class="alignnone size-thumbnail wp-image-1103" title="291958_10150259138660163_732270162_7888795_2155774_n" src="http://www.pyromancy.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/06/291958_10150259138660163_732270162_7888795_2155774_n-150x150.jpg" alt="" width="150" height="150" /></a><a href="http://www.pyromancy.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/06/73947_457681394090_6770942_n.jpg"><img src="http://www.pyromancy.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/06/73947_457681394090_6770942_n-150x150.jpg" alt="" title="73947_457681394090_6770942_n" width="150" height="150" class="alignnone size-thumbnail wp-image-1122" /></a>

<!-- Facebook Badge START --><a style="font-family: 'lucida grande',tahoma,verdana,arial,sans-serif; font-size: 11px; font-variant: normal; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; color: #3b5998; text-decoration: none;" title="होल्ल्य गेओर्गे-रुत्कौस्कि" href="https://www.facebook.com/hollynrutkowski" target="_TOP">होल्ल्य गेओर्गे-रुत्कौस्कि</a>
<a title="होल्ल्य गेओर्गे-रुत्कौस्कि" href="https://www.facebook.com/hollynrutkowski" target="_TOP"><img style="border: 0px;" src="https://badge.facebook.com/badge/35400431.637.1279879379.png" alt="" /></a>
<a style="font-family: 'lucida grande',tahoma,verdana,arial,sans-serif; font-size: 11px; font-variant: normal; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; color: #3b5998; text-decoration: none;" title="Make your own badge!" href="http://www.facebook.com/badges/" target="_TOP">Create Your Badge</a><!-- Facebook Badge END --></div>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Workshop Offerings</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/about/workshop-offerings/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 15 Aug 2012 15:57:55 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.pyromancy.org/?page_id=1253</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1253</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2012-08-15 11:57:55]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2012-08-15 15:57:55]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[workshop-offerings]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>2</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[page]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_page_template]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[default]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Kindle</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/about/performers/kindle/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 08 Jan 2014 21:19:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?page_id=1601</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The first time Kindle saw someone perform with fire she knew it was something she needed to do. Beginning as a self-taught poi spinner she eventually branched out into other props including fans, dart, fleshing and eating. As her passion for the dance pushed her to connect with others she began attending wildfire retreats and eventually left Buffalo to focus on developing as a performer. She worked as a traveling street performer and collaborated with other spinners in Maine and Oregon until finally settling in Tucson, Arizona to work with the troupe Elemental Artistry. Presently Kindle is happy to be back in Buffalo working with Pyromancy and working to develop existing prop skills and partner performance. Kindle loves sharing, exchanging, learning and jumps at the opportunity to trade skills with other performers, artists and magic makers.
	
]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1601</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2014-01-08 16:19:49]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2014-01-08 21:19:49]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[kindle]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>816</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[page]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>

			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[default]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Phil Wackerfuss</title>
		<link>http://pyromancy.org/about/performers/phil-wackerfuss/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 08 Jan 2014 21:25:41 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[gbtunney]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/?page_id=1604</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<strong>Props:</strong> Staff, sword, fans

Phil Wackerfuss hails from the land of Chicago, IL. With a BA in Theatre Arts from Illinois Wesleyan Univ, he came to Buffalo 4 years ago to work for Buffalo's premier touring dance company, <a href="http://www.lehrerdance.org/">LehrerDance</a>. With LehrerDance, he has travelled across the country and the globe, using experience from all kinds of theatrical performance to wow audiences from Germany to Russia in the LehrerDance jazz-modern style of circularity, 3-dimensionality, and momentum that we call "Organic Athleticism". Always wanting to expand talents and enhance physical feats, Phil picked up something like a staff from a prop mistress and began playing with incorporating it in a dance. Drawing inspiration from martial arts, modern dance, and a sense of mythology, Phil is honing his fire-play with staff, sword, and whatever else works naturally with his body, seeing it all as part of a larger practice of meditation and wholeness of being. Self-taught in spinning for a year, he has recently joined forces with Pyromancy and continues to spread knowledge and learn from the varied experiences of those around him.

To see more of LehrerDance visit <a href="http://www.lehrerdance.org/">LehrerDance.org</a> for promo vids, pictures, and event schedules.

<img style="width:550px;height:366px;" src="http://localhost/PYROMANCY2016/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2013/11/559783_10200426756102422_827671673_n.jpg"/></img>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1604</wp:post_id>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<strong>Props: </strong>Poi<strong>
</strong>
Bio coming soon!

Working backstage in NYC's buzzing rave scene was where David first encountered poi, and he was instantly hooked. Joining up with Pyromancy after coming to Buffalo to study science, his other interests include synesthetic artwork and martial arts.
<div align="center">

[gallery]

			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[draft]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_desired_post_slug]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
</channel>
</rss>
